text:
I tried to find a way to apply select with a transformation to a dataframe’s columns 7:32 except column 8. I failed. I even found a package, InvertedIndices, but I don’t think it would have helped either. I got it to work by first re-ordering.
(Actually I would have liked to apply it to all columns with a column name that’s a symbol starting with the letter ‘Q’ and the column data type would be String.)
Anyway this worked after the re-ordering:
```df2 = select(df, 
	1:6, 
	names(df, 7:32) .=> ByRow(string_with_na_to_float),
	renamecols=false)```

elements.text:
I tried to find a way to apply select with a transformation to a dataframe’s columns 7:32 except column 8. I failed. I even found a package, InvertedIndices, but I don’t think it would have helped either. I got it to work by first re-ordering.
(Actually I would have liked to apply it to all columns with a column name that’s a symbol starting with the letter ‘Q’ and the column data type would be String.)
Anyway this worked after the re-ordering:

text:
columns starting with `Q` and having `String` eltype is:
```intersect(names(df, r"^Q"), names(df, String))```
Why can I find an emoticon with a mouth that’s wide enough open!? :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: Why can I find an emoticon with a mouth that’s wide enough open!?

text: Thanks. Now I will need to figure out how to find or remember this info in the future.

elements.text: Thanks. Now I will need to figure out how to find or remember this info in the future.

text: `names` allows to select column names using any standard column selector (`Symbol`, string or integer; `:`, `Cols`, `All`, `Between`, `Not`, a regular expression, or a vector of `Symbols`, strings or integers) or a `Type`

text: Well, I definitely don’t get all the possibilities here yet.

text: Everything except `Type` (which is specific to `names`) is described here: <https://dataframes.juliadata.org/stable/lib/indexing/#General-rules>
I remember seeing that page and skipping it as it looked kind of intimidating. :slightly_smiling_face:
